items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: Physical Natural Gas Sputters as Winter Loosens Grip
items.summary: Daily natural gas cash prices for delivery Friday and Saturday declined across most of the Lower 48 on Thursday as forecasts leaned toward mild weather and supply proved sufficient.

items.title: Cheniere Brings Another Train Online at Corpus Christi LNG
items.summary: Cheniere Energy Inc. produced first LNG this week from the fifth train at its Corpus Christi LNG (CCL) Stage 3 expansion in South Texas and remains on track to bring the project’s remaining two trains online by this fall, management said Thursday dur

items.title: Futures Settle: April Natural Gas Debuts Meekly After Storage Shortfall Dwindles
items.summary: April natural gas futures flopped in the contract’s initial run as the front month on Thursday after a lean government inventory report all but erased a winter storage deficit.

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Natural Gas Cash Slides on Weak Demand Indicators
items.summary: Spot natural gas prices for Friday through Saturday delivery fell across North America as forecasts offered little support and storage deficits all but disappeared.

items.title: U.S. Natural Gas Exports Keep Rising on Record LNG, Mexico Demand
items.summary: Total U.S. natural gas exports are charging toward historic highs as feed gas to LNG terminals nears a record 20 Bcf/d, bolstered by resilient demand from pipeline flows into Mexico.

items.title: Forward Natural Gas Prices Post Fourth Straight Week of Losses as Spring Approaches
items.summary: Bearish forecasts and the upcoming shoulder season weighed on forward natural gas prices through next winter over the past week.

items.title: Transco Gets FERC Green Light to Build 1.6 Bcf/d Southeast Natural Gas Supply Expansion
items.summary: Federal regulators gave the go-ahead for Transcontinental Gas Pipe Line Co. LLC (Transco) to begin construction on its 1.6 Bcf/d Southeast Supply Enhancement (SSE) project, aimed at easing constraints on the mainline from Station 165 in Virginia into

items.title: MidDay Futures: Natural Gas Slipping on Bearish Weather, Inventory Outlooks
items.summary: In its debut at the front of the curve, the April Nymex gas futures contract lost ground through midday Thursday as markets eyed unseasonably mild forecasts and a razor-thin storage deficit to the five-year average.

items.title: The 2026 Outlook for South America’s Top 5 Oil Producers
items.summary: Last year was an event-filled period for South America’s growing oil industry. The continent’s energy map is being rewritten by a few unexpected world-class oil booms, which makes the region a key source of non-OPEC production growth. There is also t

items.title: Britain Reconsiders 78% North Sea Oil Tax as Investment Slows
items.summary: The UK may be quietly inching toward an awkward admission: the windfall tax experiment on oil and gas has been a flop. The Treasury is holding talks with North Sea oil and gas producers about potentially scrapping the Energy Profits Levy before its s

items.title: The Hidden Math Behind Rising Electricity Prices

items.title: Trump Administration Reopens Door to Offshore Oil Leasing in California
items.summary: Federal regulators have officially reopened a door California politicians have spent years trying to weld shut. The Bureau of Ocean Energy Management on Thursday announced it will prepare a programmatic environmental impact statement for potential oi

items.title: Cheniere’s Profit Soars by 64% in 2025 as LNG Demand Jumps
items.summary: Cheniere Energy (NYSE: LNG), the biggest U.S. LNG exporter, booked a 64% surge in its net income for 2025 from a year earlier, as it produced and exported a record amount of the fuel last year. Cheniere on Thursday reported a net income of $5.33 bill

items.title: Moscow Brands EU Leaders “Madmen” Over Oil Ban
items.summary: Russia is not amused. Moscow on Thursday blasted the European Union’s plan to permanently ban Russian oil imports, with Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova calling the proposal madness and suggesting only a “madman” would even float the idea

items.title: Full EU Ban on Russian Oil Shipping Services Requires Global G7 Approval
